metadata.case_name: Bhanu Kumar Shastri v. Mohan Lal Sukhadia

facts.text: Election to Rajasthan Legislative Assembly from Udaipur City Assembly Constituency held on 15 February 1967; result declared on 21 February 1967.
Respondent Mohan Lal Sukhadia (Congress, Chief Minister) polled 24272 votes; appellant (Jan Sangh) obtained 20841 votes; margin 3431 votes.
After election, Congress reduced to minority; Sukhadia tendered resignation; President's Rule declared on 13 March 1967, withdrawn 26 April 1967; Sukhadia again Chief Minister.
Election petition filed by appellant on 7 April 1967 challenging Sukhadia's election.
Respondent applied to strike vague allegations under Section 83 RP Act; High Court ordered particulars; appellant furnished on 29 May 1967.
High Court allowed incorporation of particulars and amended petition on 19 July 1967; finally amended on 13 November 1967.
Appellant examined 30 witnesses; respondent 46; High Court dismissed petition on 10 May 1968, all issues in favour of respondent, own costs.
Allegations in paras 8,9,10,11: corrupt practices of bribery (S.123(1)) and undue influence (S.123(2)) re: pattas in Raigar Colony, road at Tekri, Nallah in Baluchistan Colony, water-taps.
Para 9: Sukhadia at meeting 5 Feb 1967 in Raigar Colony promised pattas at Re.1/- to induce votes; order No.66/5077 dated 10 Feb 1967 issued.
Raigar Colony pattas policy from 27 April 1959 (Ex.A-99), clarified 26 Feb 1962 (Ex.A-100); disputes with Urban Improvement Trust over development charges since 1955.
Keshulal application 29 Dec 1966 to Sukhadia; office notes Ex.270 (21 Jan 1967), Ex.271 (5 Feb 1967); Ex.44 (10 Feb 1967) from Director Social Welfare.
Meeting at Raigar Colony 5 Feb 1967 alleged; witnesses PW4 Lakshmi Narain, PW12 Kalu Ram; Shankar Harijan, Keshulal not examined; Sukhadia tour programme shows other meetings 3-5:30pm.
Para 8: Sukhadia ordered PWD to construct road at Tekri (municipal area); meeting 5 Feb 1967 promised roads, water-taps for votes.
Tekri road: planned 1965-66 due to new railway station, police objection; special repairs approach road; agreements Ex.A/128 (10 Feb 1967 earthwork), Ex.A/130 (1 Apr 1967 soling); total ~Rs.20,000.
Witnesses PW25 Phoola, PW28 Madan Lal disbelieved re: road completed days before polling, bargain.
Baluchistan Colony Nallah: scheme from Sep 1966 (Ex.A-31), Municipal resolution 27 Aug 1966 (Ex.A-28) due to accidents, insanitation; tenders Dec 1966; work started Jan 1967 anticipation sanction.
Nallah: telegram Ex.7-A 10 Feb 1967; sanctions 24 Feb, 31 Mar, 27 Jun 1967; work completed 28 Nov 1967.
Water-taps: 50 public hydrants installed 2-3 days before poll; no evidence respondent influenced.

Paras 12-15 (issue 4): Ex.8 leaflet defamatory re: appellant's encroachment Shivaji Nagar; printed Krishna Press (Girdhari Lal's?); distributed by Hanuman Prashad etc.; oral statements 10 Feb 1967 meetings.
Ex.8 printed by District Congress Committee via Bhagwati Lal Bhat for Bhuleshwar Mina; no consent/knowledge of Sukhadia or agent Girdhari Lal.

legal_issues.text: Are allegations in paras 8,9,10,11 correct? If so, did respondent commit corrupt practice u/s 123(1) or 123(2) RP Act? (Issue 3a,3b)
Are allegations in paras 12,13,14,15 correct? If so, did respondent commit corrupt practice u/s 123(4) RP Act? (Issue 4a,4b)

petitioner_arguments.text: Sukhadia promised pattas at Re.1/- at Raigar Colony meeting 5 Feb 1967 to induce votes; Ex.271 (5 Feb), Ex.44 (10 Feb) evidence of bribery u/s 123(1).
Sukhadia ordered PWD road at Tekri, promised at meeting 5 Feb 1967 for votes; work started post-visit, completed pre-poll without sanction; contravention Rajasthan Urban Improvement Act s.72.
petitioner_arguments.legal_basis: Section 123(1),(2) RP Act; Rajasthan Urban Improvement Act s.72

petitioner_arguments.text: Sukhadia ordered Nallah covering Baluchistan Colony, promised voters; urgency faked.
Ex.8 leaflet false defamatory statement re: appellant's character/conduct; printed by/with consent agent Girdhari Lal; oral repeats 10 Feb.

respondent_arguments.text: Raigar pattas longstanding policy 1959/1962; Ex.271 office note on old file post-Keshulal Dec 1966 app; no meeting 5 Feb per tour programme; witnesses unreliable.
Tekri road longstanding 1965-66 plan, special repairs; valid piecework agreements <Rs.2500 petty work no tender needed; no bargain evidence.
Nallah scheme 1966 Municipal urgency; anticipation sanction valid; no promise.
Ex.8 printed District Congress for another candidate; no knowledge/consent respondent/agent; statement not calculated to prejudice.

court_reasoning.text: No proof of Raigar meeting/bargain; witnesses unreliable (PW4,12); tour programme conflicts; Ex.271 office note on 1959 policy file; no new temptation.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Oral evidence concocted; longstanding grievance, no election bargain.

court_reasoning.text: Tekri road valid special repairs; piecework agreements proper; soling dates explained; no irregularity; witnesses disbelieved; no bargain.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Longstanding plan; normal activity not corrupt.

court_reasoning.text: Nallah longstanding urgency 1966; anticipation sanction/telegram genuine; no motive/bargain linked to election.
court_reasoning.key_observation: Ordinary official duty; no corrupt motive.

court_reasoning.text: Ex.8 printed by District Congress for other candidate; no consent/knowledge respondent/agent; not calculated to prejudice prospects.
Ministers' bona fide official acts not corrupt even pre-election; thin line between evil and corrupt practice; onus on petitioner for serious charge.
court_reasoning.key_observation: No abuse of position; longstanding grievances redressed normally.

holdings.text: No corrupt practices u/s 123(1),(2),(4) committed by respondent; allegations not proved.
Ex.8 not published with consent/knowledge; does not prejudice election prospects.
Respondent can support High Court judgment on grounds decided against him without cross-appeal per O.41 R.22 CPC via s.116C RP Act.

precedents_cited.case_name: Ramanbhai Ashabhai Patel v. Dabhi Ajitkumar Fulsinji
precedents_cited.relevance: Respondent can support judgment on negatived grounds without appeal.

precedents_cited.case_name: T. N. Angami v. Smt. Ravalu Reno M. Shaiza
precedents_cited.relevance: Reiterated Ramanbhai on respondent supporting judgment.
Ministers' discretionary grants pre-election; bona fide acts not corrupt.

precedents_cited.case_name: Om Prabha Jain v. Abhash Chand
precedents_cited.relevance: Similar to Ghasi Ram on ministers' acts and thin line evil/corrupt practice.

statutes_cited.name: Representation of the People Act, 1951
statutes_cited.relevance: Particulars in petition; corrupt practices (bribery, undue influence, personal character); appeal procedure.

statutes_cited.name: Rajasthan Urban Improvement Act
statutes_cited.relevance: Restrictions on improvements; argued re: Tekri road, not proved applicable.

statutes_cited.name: Public Works Department Financial and Accounts Rules
statutes_cited.relevance: Piecework, petty work, anticipation of funds for Tekri road, Nallah.

statutes_cited.name: Code of Civil Procedure
statutes_cited.relevance: Respondent can support on any ground.

outcome.summary: Supreme Court dismissed the appeal, upheld High Court dismissal of election petition; no corrupt practices proved; parties to bear own costs.
outcome.costs: Parties will pay and bear their own costs.

key_quotes.text: The position of a Minister is difficult. It is obvious that he cannot cease to function when his election is due.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Explains ministers cannot halt normal duties pre-election.

key_quotes.text: To arrange to spend money on the eve of elections in different constituencies although for general public good, is when all is said and done an evil practice.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Distinguishes evil from corrupt practice; advises avoiding pre-election spending.

key_quotes.text: If everyone of his official acts done bona fide is to be construed against him and an ulterior motive is spelled out of them, the administration must necessarily come to a stand-still.
key_quotes.speaker: court
key_quotes.significance: Protects bona fide official acts from corrupt practice allegations.
